doc.field: Gina Tlamsa is an American musician and radio host. Between 1981 and 1986 she hosted and produced The Shamrock Shore, a weekly two-hour live radio program on Columbia University's WKCR. The Gina Tlamsa Papers document Tlamsa's interest in Irish and Irish-American political activity in the 1980s and include ephemera, periodicals, letters, and audiovisual material. The collection dates between 1966 and 1997, with the bulk of the material between 1980 and 1986. Topics include Irish Republican issues, in particular hunger strikes in Northern Ireland, human rights issues in Northern Ireland, political prisoners in Northern Ireland and the United States.

Gina Tlamsa is an American musician and radio host. Between 1981 and 1986 she hosted and produced The Shamrock Shore, a weekly two-hour live radio program on Columbia University's WKCR. The Gina Tlamsa Papers document Tlamsa's interest in Irish and Irish-American political activity in the 1980s and include ephemera, periodicals, letters, and audiovisual material. The collection dates between 1966 and 1997, with the bulk of the material between 1980 and 1986. Topics include Irish Republican issues, in particular hunger strikes in Northern Ireland, human rights issues in Northern Ireland, political prisoners in Northern Ireland and the United States.

The Gina Tlamsa Papers document Tlamsa's interest in Irish and Irish-American political activity in the 1980s and include ephemera, periodicals, government publications, letters, and audiovisual material. The collection dates between 1966 and 1997, with the bulk of the material between 1980 and 1986. Topics include Irish Republican issues, in particular hunger strikes in Northern Ireland, human rights issues in Northern Ireland, and political prisoners in Northern Ireland and the United States, in particular Joe Doherty. Ephemera includes flyers, newsletters, bumper stickers, and posters from Irish and Irish-American organizations, including New York H-Block/Armagh Committee, American Irish Unity Committee, American Irish Heritage Foundation, Irish-American Defense Fund, Northern Ireland Civil Rights Association, Irish Northern Aid-IPOW Hunger Strike Defense Fund, and Sinn Fein. Periodicals include Éire-Ireland, Guth An Phobial, Saoirse na h-Éireann, The Spirit of Freedom, The Irish American Voice, Irish Echo, and The Irish People. Government publications include two reports on hearings in the United States Senate, the first on the United States and United Kingdom Supplementary Extradition Treaty in 1985 and the second on Issues Relating to the Deportation of Michael O'Rourke in 1984. Audiovisual material includes audio recordings of three 1983 episodes of The Shamrock Shore, Ronald Reagan's 1984 speech to the Dáil Eireann, a 1984 Easter Rising commemoration, and other radio programs on Irish topics.

Gina Tlamsa is an American musician and radio host. Between 1981 and 1986 she hosted and produced The Shamrock Shore, a weekly two-hour live radio program on Columbia University's WKCR. The program included traditional Irish music, announcements of local Irish community events, Irish news, and interviews.
Donated by Gina Tlamsa in December 2002 and May 2003. The accession number associated with this collection is 1997.029.

Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
